p: We considered SNPs with large allele frequency shifts between the modern and historic time periods that could not be attributed to demography as evidence for positive selection. We used the program OutFLANK [ 50] to detect F ST outlier SNPs (FDR q-value < 0.01), empirically adjusting the degrees of freedom of Ï‡ 2-distributed F ST values to account for the influence of demography. We then compared the observed SNP F ST values to null exome-wide and per-site F ST distributions generated by performing 1,500 neutral simulations under the best fitting population history for YNP T. alpinus.
